This is how we define a variable in C++. But do you know what happens behind the scenes when we define a variable? The address helps us to identify that block, that is to search for that block. Now these are simplified addresses. I'm not saying these addresses will be allocated. These addresses are simplified versions of the more complex addresses. For simplification, I chose these addresses. It is the general assumption that an integer takes 4 bytes of memory. So clearly from the size computer knows how many blocks this specific data needs.
